title: Vintage Track & Field
description: Race through history and remember the incredible track and field athletes who inspired generations with their speed and strength!

questions.question: Jesse Owens won four gold medals at which Olympic Games, defying Adolf Hitler's claims of Aryan supremacy?
Roger Bannister made history in 1954 by being the first person to do what?
At the 1968 Mexico City Olympics, which American sprinter raised a black-gloved fist on the medal podium in a civil rights protest?
Which American decathlete won gold at the 1960 and 1964 Olympics and was called 'the world's greatest athlete'?
Bob Beamon shattered the long jump world record at the 1968 Olympics with a leap of how far?
Wilma Rudolph overcame childhood polio to win three gold medals in sprinting at which Olympics?
Which Finnish runner, known as 'The Flying Finn,' dominated distance running in the 1970s and won the 1972 and 1976 Olympic 10,000 meters?
Dick Fosbury revolutionized the high jump at the 1968 Olympics by introducing what technique?
Which American sprinter was known as 'The Fastest Woman in the World' and won three gold medals at the 1960 Rome Olympics?
At the 1936 Berlin Olympics, Jesse Owens won gold in the 100m, 200m, long jump, and which relay event?
Bruce Jenner won the decathlon gold medal at which Olympic Games?
Carl Lewis won four gold medals at the 1984 Los Angeles Olympics, matching which previous athlete's feat?
Al Oerter achieved the remarkable feat of winning the Olympic discus throw at four consecutive Olympics. Which years?
The first man to run 100 meters in under 10 seconds with electronic timing was Jim Hines at which event?
Bob Mathias became the youngest male to win an Olympic gold medal in track and field when he won the decathlon in 1948 at what age?
